intro: Dondia depressa var. erecta, commonly known as the upright dondia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
